content:
From the latest version of the WHO's Interim Guidance for Smart Vaccination Certificates...
• The normative base code system for the SVC is ICD-11. For COVID-19, a 1-to-1 mapping is included in the specification between ICD-11 and SNOMED GPS.
• includes a one-to-one map between relevant ICD-11 codes and the functionally equivalent code in the SNOMED Global Patient Set (GPS).

Has anyone seen the relevant ICD-11 Codes?

https://www.snomed.org/news-and-events/articles/Jan-31-2021-SNOMED-Intl-Edition

https://confluence.ihtsdotools.org/display/snomed/SNOMED+CT+COVID-19+Related+Content
https://www.snomed.org/snomed-ct/covid-19
The urls above link to COVID-19 related content. But therelevant ICD-11 codes are not found.

WHO ICD-11 Codes:

RA01 COVID-19
https://icd.who.int/browse11/l-m/en#/http://id.who.int/icd/entity/1730556128

RA02 Post COVID-19 condition
https://icd.who.int/browse11/l-m/en#/http://id.who.int/icd/entity/2024855916

QA08.5 Special screening examination for other viral diseases
https://icd.who.int/browse11/l-m/en#/http://id.who.int/icd/entity/412651167

XN109 SARS-CoV-2
https://icd.who.int/browse11/l-m/en#/http://id.who.int/icd/entity/243015485

No record for 2020 and later

https://confluence.ihtsdotools.org/display/CDR/ICD-11+Map

Thanks for those links @Lin Zhang - however, I'm looking specifically for the ICD-11 codes for the COVID-19 Vaccines as that's the WHO's 'normative base code system' for Smart Vaccination Certificates.
There are no codes for SARS-CoV-2 vaccines under ICD-11 XM61M7 Viral vaccines for now (ICD-11 MMS Version : 09/2020).
See https://icd.who.int/browse11/l-m/en#/http%3a%2f%2fid.who.int%2ficd%2fentity%2f1347156717
Also See https://www.who.int/publications/m/item/core-data-set-for-the-smart-vaccination-certificate
In the core dataset above, you can find the ICD-11 Extension Codes for the vaccine types or subtypes, and not limited to SARS-CoV-2 or even viruses.

And the spreadsheet is an attachment of the following guidance:
Call for public comments: Interim guidance for developing a Smart Vaccination Certificate – Release Candidate 1 (19 March 2021 Call for consultation)
https://www.who.int/news-room/articles-detail/call-for-public-comments-interim-guidance-for-developing-a-smart-vaccination-certificate-release-candidate-1
Many thanks @Lin Zhang - so the ICD-11 COVID-19 Vaccines are 'Extension Codes'. Do you know if this can be used now, or are they subject to an approval process?
Is one supposed to record the Foundation code or the MMS code?

An example
ICD-11 Extension code for COVID-19 vaccine, inactivated virus: http://id.who.int/icd/entity/164949870

It looks like the former.

@Peter Jordan
I think they would need to be formally published because the guidance is still in Call for Comments phase.

Any questions, please contact: smartvaccination@who.int

Lin Zhang said:

An example
ICD-11 Extension code for COVID-19 vaccine, inactivated virus: http://id.who.int/icd/entity/164949870

It looks like the former.

That doesn't look right to me as an individual vaccine code - as http://id.who.int/icd/entity/164949870 covers all the Vaccine Codes. In FHIR terms, I'd expect to see something like this in a ValueSet expansion.

<contains>
            <system value="http://id.who.int/icd11/foundation" />
            <code value="XM0GQ8" />
            <display value="COVID-19 vaccine, RNA based" />
 </contains>

It would be interesting to see what others think, as I am very new to ICD-11.
@Grahame Grieve This question is also related to the url of ICD-11 (Foundation).
(deleted)

The WHO is mandating manufacturer as part of their Smart Vaccine Certificate spec. So, this code would be used in combination with the manufacturer or market auth. So, unlike LOINC which lists every individual, ICD-11 just cares about type.

David Pyke said:

The WHO is mandating manufacturer as part of their Smart Vaccine Certificate spec. So, this code would be used in combination with the manufacturer or market auth. So, unlike LOINC which lists every individual, ICD-11 just cares about type.

AFAIA, LOINC doesn't currently have any COVID-19 Vaccine Codes (and I have the latest version, 2.69, on my Server and all the pre-release, special use terms).

As a point of reference: in VCI, our value set so far includes CVX codes, which bring these details (vaccine type, manufacturer) together in product-specific ways. http://build.fhir.org/ig/dvci/vaccine-credential-ig/branches/main/index.html has details.
https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/programs/iis/COVID-19-related-codes.html gives a sense of the information that a CVX code conveys (vs packaging details like carton size, which are separate).

Thanks, @Josh Mandel. We are using the CVX Codes at the data entry point in NZ. It's likely that we will then map them to the SNOMED CT codes for HIE purposes. A growing collection of COVID-19 Vaccine Codes can be obtained here... https://terminz.azurewebsites.net/fhir/ValueSet/covid-19-vaccines/$expand I haven't added the ICD-11 ones yet as I'm not sure if they're official (and who has actually implemented ICD-11?).
XM0GQ8 is an MMS code, not a foundation code?
We need to get some clarity on this - particularly from WHO.

The ICD-11 Reference Guide states that "The Foundation Component is a multidimensional collection of all ICD entities. Entities can be diseases, disorders, injuries, external causes, signs and symptoms."

WHO ICD-11 (Foundation) - ICD-11 Maintenance Platform
https://icd.who.int/dev11/f/en
Last Update: Mar 22, 2021

COVID-19 vaccine - WHO ICD-11 (Foundation)
https://icd.who.int/dev11/f/en#/http%3a%2f%2fid.who.int%2ficd%2fentity%2f894585096

894585096 COVID-19 vaccine
---- 1104808441 COVID-19 vaccine, inactivated virus
---- 993066376 COVID-19 vaccine, live attenuated virus
---- 264142908 COVID-19 vaccine, non-replicating viral vector
---- 877986394 COVID-19 vaccine, replicating viral vector
---- 1368305645 COVID-19 vaccine, virus protein subunit
---- 729916172 COVID-19 vaccine, virus like particle (VLP)
---- 1316179031 COVID-19 vaccine, DNA based
---- 873941688 COVID-19 vaccine, RNA based

IMPORTANT Note: The content made availabe here is not a released version of the ICD-11. It is a work in progress in between released versions
ICD-11 codes for Covid-11 for SVC-RC1 are here https://who-int.github.io/svc/artifacts.html#2 these are draft and will be added to.

It is part of the larger core data set and business requirements: https://www.who.int/news-room/articles-detail/call-for-public-comments-interim-guidance-for-developing-a-smart-vaccination-certificate-release-candidate-1

@Carl Leitner - The links in that IG point to the 09/2020 version of ICD-11 MMS which, for obvious reasons, doesn't actually contain any COVID-19 Vaccine Codes. Hopefully, in time , the extension concepts listed by @Lin Zhang above will be accessible from the IG.
@Lin Zhang I notice, from the SVC thread that there are now MMS Codes for these 9 ICD-11 COVID-19 concepts. Do you know whether implementers should be using the MMS or the Foundation Codes?

The final version of the SVC IG might still being in process, I guess, because the deadline to provide constructive feedback on this document by 12 April 2021 as the following page shows:

https://www.who.int/news-room/articles-detail/call-for-public-comments-interim-guidance-for-developing-a-smart-vaccination-certificate-release-candidate-1
I'll check the status of the codes in the ICD-11 Foundation.

In the MMS, no codes for COVID-19 Vaccines officially published yet:

https://icd.who.int/browse11/l-m/en

See XM61M7 Viral vaccines for details:
https://icd.who.int/browse11/l-m/en#/http://id.who.int/icd/entity/1347156717

@Peter Jordan So the referenced ICD-11 MMS url (https://icd.who.int/browse11) is misleading in the definition of the ValueSet: WHO Vaccine List(https://who-int.github.io/svc/refs/heads/rc2/ValueSet-who-svc-vaccines.html).

Peter Jordan said:

Do you know whether implementers should be using the MMS or the Foundation Codes?

MMS or Foundation?
MMS in general.
but you should know why you are using ICD-11, and that should actually drive your answer
